result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather D Koerbel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 90 days or penalty of 5 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather D Koerbel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Heather D Koerbel in court with Attorney Joseph Smith.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State moves to amend Count #1 to county ordinance disorderly conduct.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to amended charge.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge and imposes fine of $267.50 - to be paid in 90 days, alternate 5 days jail if not paid.  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant to have no violent contact with victim/witnesses or their residences listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. 09/11/2015 DEFENDANT TO REPORT/COMPLY with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.

Defendant Heather D Koerbel in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Smith states that upon compliance with 3 months of WCS monitoring the State would move to amend. Court amends bond. Court adjourns.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Heather D Koerbel in court with Attorney Joseph Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith reqeusts a 30 day adjournment.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Heather D Koerbel in court.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states she is not represented by an Attorney. Defendant states that she would like representation. Defendant ordered to go to PD's office before next hearing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no violent contact with victim/witnesses or their residences listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Heather D Koerbel in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 10:30 am.
